item.title: Your Computer overall base rating!
item.dc:creator: @Cruel_Truth Cruel Truth
item.description:
@Cruel_Truth wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:46, topic:506901”][quote author=Cruel Truth link=topic=625133.msg4257649#msg4257649 date=1363037290]

spec wise, it would be better no question asked.
game wise, you are right but on every major game out there there is normally somebody making a native client of some kind for it.

No… it isn’t better spec-wise
Also native client has nothing to do with the ability to render 3d games, unless you plan on playing games on a Linux server… Good loveing luck with that
[/quote]most operating systems that could handle that type of hardware would be Red Hat :s

and yes spec wise! Think about it if you have a quad core 12gb pc. In reality you are only running like 3gb on one core. (or at least this is my understanding)

You obviously don’t understand that RAM doesn’t straight-up determine the speed of the computer…[/quote] I never claimed to be an expert.

I do know there are several factors that do affect the performance of a computer though as well such as :

-heat from the cores/hard drive/(bus?)
-what processes are being ran
-viruses etc

Read full topic

item.title: Your Computer overall base rating!
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“zuppers, post:48, topic:506901”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=625133.msg4257637#msg4257637 date=1363036353]

[/img]http://puu.sh/2g3JG[/img]
[/img]http://puu.sh/2g3K4[/img]
[/img]http://puu.sh/2g3Lj[/img]
[/img]http://puu.sh/2g3L6[/img]
[/img]http://puu.sh/2g3KF[/img]
Cpu: AMD A8-3870K Overclocked to 3.4GHz (3Ghz normal)
Case: COOLER MASTER Storm Enforcer SGC-1000-KWN1
Motherboard: BIOSTAR TA75A+
SSD: Crucial M4 CT128M4SSD2CCA 2.5" 128GB SATA III
RAM: G.SKILL Ripjaws X Series 8GB (2 x 4GB) DDR3 1866
CPU Cooler: CORSAIR Hydro Series H80i
Power Supply: OCZ ModXStream Pro 700W Modular
GPU :ASUS HD7850-DC2-2GD5-V2 Radeon HD

You have the H80i? Have you got it to work properly?

My Corsair link software doesn’t detect the pump, and the fans don’t work when plugged into the pump…
[/quote]Works like a charm, when I first plugged it in the fan was a little noisy because of a firmware issue but I updated the firmware and its been running pretty much 24/7 since I bought it.[/quote]
Hmm, there’s been so many problems with them, been accepted for an RMA, but they want me to ship it all the way to netherlands which will cost a fortune, takes the piss really

item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:


Hopefully getting a new graphics card this weekend:

amazon.com

Amazon.com: EVGA GeForce GTX 660Ti 2048MB GDDR5 DVI-I, DVI-D, HDMI, DP, SLI Graphics Card (02G-P4-3660-KR) Graphics Cards 02G-P4-3660-KR: Electronics

Get the weapon of choice for gamers – the EVGA GeForce GTX 660 Ti. It adds a new dimension to the NVIDIA Kepler-powered family of graphics cards by delivering the ideal fusion of power, performance, a ...


newegg.com

ASUS GTX660 TI-DC2O-2GD5 G-SYNC Support GeForce GTX 660 Ti 2GB 192-Bit GDDR5 PCI...

Buy ASUS GTX660 TI-DC2O-2GD5 G-SYNC Support GeForce GTX 660 Ti 2GB 192-Bit GDDR5 PCI Express 3.0 x16 HDCP Ready SLI Support Video Card with fast shipping and top-rated customer service. Once you know, you Newegg!

Not sure which I’m going to pick, most like the EVGA though. I’ve never had too much experience with graphics cards before, so not sure which brand is preferred.

item.title: Your Computer overall base rating!
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Cruel Truth, post:45, topic:506901”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=625133.msg4257615#msg4257615 date=1363034473]

spec wise, it would be better no question asked.
game wise, you are right but on every major game out there there is normally somebody making a native client of some kind for it.

No… it isn’t better spec-wise
Also native client has nothing to do with the ability to render 3d games, unless you plan on playing games on a Linux server… Good loveing luck with that
[/quote]most operating systems that could handle that type of hardware would be Red Hat :s

and yes spec wise! Think about it if you have a quad core 12gb pc. In reality you are only running like 3gb on one core. (or at least this is my understanding)[/quote]
You obviously don’t understand that RAM doesn’t straight-up determine the speed of the computer…

Read full topic
